            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "* `NAN` (PHP's Not-a-Number) equates to `true`, i.e. `NAN == true` is `true`. This is because `NAN` is a _nonzero_ floating-point value.\n* Zero-values include both +0 and -0 as defined by IEEE 754. PHP does not distinguish between +0 and -0 in its double-precision floating-point, i.e. `floatval('0') == floatval('-0')` is `true`. \n    * In fact, `floatval('0') === floatval('-0')`. \n    * Additionally, both `floatval('0') == false` and `floatval('-0') == false`."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

            "title": [
              ["The "],
              ["strpos($haystack, $needle)", [["c"]]],
              [" language function is used to locate the index at which "],
              ["$needle", [["c"]]],
              [" occurs in "],
              ["$haystack", [["c"]]],
              [", or whether it occurs at all. The "],
              ["strpos()", [["c"]]],
              [
                " function is case sensitive; if case-insensitive find is what you need you can go with "
              ],
              ["stripos($haystack, $needle)", [["c"]]]
            ]
